titleStmt.title: Ane detectioun of the duinges of Marie Quene of Scottes thouchand the murder of hir husband, and hir conspiracie, adulterie, and pretensed mariage with the Erle Bothwell. And ane defence of the trew Lordis, mainteineris of the Kingis graces actioun and authoritie. Translatit out of the Latine quhilke was written by G.B.
De Maria Scotorum regina. English
titleStmt.author: Buchanan, George, 1506-1582.
Wilson, Thomas, 1525?-1581.

titleStmt.title: Ane detectioun of the duinges of Marie Quene of Scottes thouchand the murder of hir husband, and hir conspiracie, adulterie, and pretensed mariage with the Erle Bothwell. And ane defence of the trew Lordis, mainteineris of the Kingis graces actioun and authoritie. Translatit out of the Latine quhilke was written by G.B.
De Maria Scotorum regina. English
titleStmt.author: Buchanan, George, 1506-1582.
Wilson, Thomas, 1525?-1581.

notesStmt.note: A translation in Scots dialect, possibly by Thomas Wilson, of: De Maria Scotorum Regina.
"Ane oratioun, with declaration of euidence against Marie the Scotishe Quene", F4v-O1v, is attributed to Thomas Wilson.
Contains a number of items not in the Latin edition.
Variant due to loosening of type: title page has "graces ctioun and aurhaoritie. Translated".
Reproduction of the original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
